articles.author: Livescience.com
articles.title: Electrifying time-lapse image captures 100 lightning bolts torching the sky over Turkey - Livescience.com
articles.description: Astrophotographer Uğur İkizler has captured a striking time-lapse photo of more than 100 individual lightning bolts during a fierce thunderstorm in Turkey. The electrifying image was created by combining shots of the sky near his home in the coastal town of Mudanya. The individual images were collected over a 50-minute period around midnight on June 16 — meaning that, on average, there was a lightning strike every 30 seconds. The thunderstorm was a "magnificent visual feast," he added.

articles.author: BBC
articles.title: Carlos Ghosn sues Nissan for $1bn in defamation suit - BBC
articles.description: Former Nissan CEO Carlos Ghosn has filed a lawsuit against the carmaker for over $1bn, accusing Nissan, two other companies, and 12 people of crimes including defamation and libel. Ghosn was ousted from the firm in 2018 and arrested in Japan on financial misconduct charges, which he denies. He fled Japan in a box while awaiting trial and now lives in Lebanon. The damages he is seeking represent over 5% of the company's market value. Nissan declined to comment. A hearing has been scheduled for September.

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Social media star Andrew Tate charged with rape and human trafficking in Romania - ABC News
articles.description: Social media personality Andrew Tate, known for expressing misogynistic views online, has been charged with rape, human trafficking, and forming a criminal gang to exploit women in Romania. Tate's brother, Tristan, and two Romanian women were also charged. The group allegedly formed in 2021 to commit human trafficking in Romania, the United States, and Britain. Seven female victims were misled and transported to Romania, where they were sexually exploited and subjected to physical violence. Tate has repeatedly claimed that Romanian prosecutors have no evidence and alleged that the case is a political conspiracy designed to silence him. The Tate brothers and the two Romanian suspects were detained in late December in Bucharest.
